alert.note: Alert for Marion (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:35PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Marion, northwestern Webster and Schley Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 435 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Draneville, or 7 miles south of Buena Vista, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buena Vista, Ellaville, Putnam, Seminole, Murrays Crossroads, Doyle, Church Hill, Draneville and Walls Crossing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
